newsitem.title: USA: Informix to cut 200 jobs in Europe.
newsitem.headline: Informix to cut 200 jobs in Europe.

text.p: Informix Corp. plans to cut 200 jobs in Europe, or 17 percent of the 1,200-employee work force there, through layoffs and attrition, a spokesman at the software company said Tuesday.

The struggling database software company already has cut 100 jobs in the United States as part of a plan to pare costs. The company plans to reduce its 4,400-employee worldwide work force by 10 percent.
"One thing we're trying to do is balance revenues and expenses geographically," said Informix spokesman Robert Manetta. "Where we see imbalances, we try to match it up."
Informix, based in Menlo Park, Calif., reported an unexpected $140.1 million loss in the first quarter as revenue plunged 34 percent to $133.7 million.

Earlier this year, the company bet its future on a new type of database software that can store graphics, sounds and other multimedia information as well as text and numbers. But sales have been disappointing because there is not much demand for the multimedia capabilites yet, company executives said.
Informix is trying to return to profit by the end of the year by cutting jobs through layoffs and attrition and paring costs.
Informix stock was up 6.25 cents at $9.375 in afternoon trading on Nasdaq.
